title: Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Schools across Cape Cod and southeastern Massachusetts cancel classes due to power outages and snow cleanup challenges post-blizzard.
Cape Cod districts including Barnstable and Falmouth face power restoration issues and tricky road conditions impacting student transport.
Over 136,500 remain without power in Massachusetts; schools join recovery efforts with Plymouth High as a Red Cross shelter.

title: Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly threatening a passenger with a gun on an MBTA bus in East Boston.
The incident occurred on Meridian Street with the suspect reportedly carrying a .40-caliber Beretta, according to police.
The man has a previous conviction for illegal firearm possession and was taken into custody for booking by MBTA Transit Police.

title: Explosion and fire at Taunton home seriously injures mother and 2-year-old child
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: An explosion and fire destroyed a home at 78 Plain St. in Taunton, injuring a mother and her 2-year-old child.
The mother and child were hospitalized with severe burns; the home, housing three families, was a total loss.
The cause of the explosion is under investigation by local police and fire departments alongside the State Fire Marshal.

title: Swayman: Team USA ‘should have reacted differently’ to Trump’s joke about US women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman expressed regret over Team USA's reaction to President Trump's joke about the women's hockey team.
The men's team celebrated winning gold, while the women's team declined Trump's invitation, citing prior commitments.
Both teams won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympics, with Swayman praising the shared achievement with the women's team.

title: MSPCA-Angell evacuates nearly 50 animals, opens shelter to pets from Cape homes without power
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MSPCA-Angell evacuated nearly 50 animals from its Cape Cod shelter due to generator fuel shortages amid power outages.
The evacuated animals, including 22 cats and 10 dogs, were relocated to MSPCA's Nevins Farm and Boston locations.
Cape Cod shelter now temporarily accommodates pets from homes without power, aiding residents via the SafePet program.

title: A small town arts scene in Vermont is among the best in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Stowe, Vermont was ranked No. 9 among USA Today's best small town arts scenes in America.
Stowe is noted for galleries and Spruce Peak Arts, offering music, dance, theater, and comedy.
The Stowe Foliage Arts Festival coincides with fall foliage, scheduled for October 9-11 this year.

title: Not in Boston? Your space saver is likely illegal.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Most Massachusetts cities outside Boston ban space savers after snowstorms, with fines up to $100 in some areas.
Boston permits space savers only during snow emergencies and 48 hours after; exceptions include Bay Village and South End.
Cambridge, Somerville, and other cities systematically remove space savers, emphasizing community cooperation in snow clearance.

title: ESPN insider has Roman Anthony ranked among MLB’s top-10 corner outfielders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roman Anthony ranks No. 7 overall among MLB corner outfielders in Buster Olney's latest ESPN ranking.
Anthony achieved a .396 on-base percentage in his rookie season, playing 71 games for the Boston Red Sox.
Despite his strong corner outfield performance, some evaluators suggest center field as Anthony's optimal position.

title: Where do you get a meal for under $20 in Malden?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for meals under $20 in Malden for an upcoming dining guide.
Malden is noted for its diverse dining scene, including Asian, Ethiopian, and barbecue cuisine options.
Submissions should include restaurant name, menu item, price, and why it's a good budget meal choice.

title: The story behind this viral photo of an unplowed Fall River street
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Fall River streets, including June Street, remain unplowed days after a major blizzard, frustrating residents.
A user-driven plow tracker shows only about 20% of Fall River streets had been cleared by Wednesday afternoon.
Mayor Paul Coogan has called in additional resources for snow removal to address the challenges faced by the city.
